intro: Licania myristicoides, commonly known as the Brazilian pepper tree, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its aromatic, small, white flowers. The plant produces small, red, fleshy fruits that are edible and often used in traditional medicine. It is a shrub or small tree that can grow up to 5 meters tall, with glossy, dark green leaves. Licania myristicoides is adapted to tropical and subtropical climates and is often found in moist, shaded areas.
